title: Create Operations Platform namespace
content:
Kubernetes supports multiple virtual clusters backed by the same physical cluster. These virtual clusters are called namespaces. A namespace creates an isolation from the other parts of the cluster. For more information, see Namespaces.

Follow these steps to create a deployment and Operations Platform namespace:

  1. Log on to the bastion or the control plane node.
  2. Run the following commands to create a deployment and namespace: 
    cd <OMT installation directory>/bin
./cdfctl deployment create -t helm -d <deployment name> -n <operations platform namespace>

    where,

    <OMT installation directory> refers to the OMT installation directory of embedded or external Kubernetes.

    <deployment name> refers to the name that you want for the Operations Platform deployment.

    <operations platform namespace> refers to the namespace which you are going to create and also in which you want to deploy Operations Platform.

    For example:

    cd OMT_External_K8s_2x.x/bin
./cdfctl deployment create -t helm -d opdeployment01 -n opnamespace01

    The output resembles the following and indicates that you have created the deployment successfully:

    [root@ExampleMachine]# cdfctl deployment create -t helm -d opdeployment01 -n opnamespace01
2021-04-13T10:00:29+08:00 INF Creating deployment ... name=opdeployment01 namespace=opnamespace01
2021-04-13T10:00:29+08:00 INF Created namespace "opnamespace01" ...
2021-04-13T10:00:29+08:00 INF Successfully created deployment "opdeployment01" uuid=e8c02e36-008d-4f91-9777-d60ce7b70bd0
  3. Run the following command to see the deployment and namespace: 
    ./cdfctl deployment get
  4. This step is applicable only if you are deploying the application on OpenShift. The user identifier (UID) and group identifier (GID) is unique for each namespace, run the following command to identify the UID and GID: 
    #kubectl get ns <op namespace>  -o yaml | grep groups 

#You must copy the output: openshift.io/sa.scc.supplemental-groups: 1000870000/10000. 
#Here 1000870000 will be used as User ID and fsGroup ID.

    Make a note of the UID and GID. You will need these when deploying Operations Platform.
